meanings.definition: (verb) to become hardened into ice or into a solid body
meanings.sent1: The water will freeze into ice if left outside in the cold.
meanings.sent2: I like to freeze fruit to make delicious popsicles.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my drink in the freezer too long, and now it's frozen solid!
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to freeze when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The fear seemed to freeze him in place, unable to move.

meanings.definition: (verb) to become fixed, immovable, or rigid
meanings.sent1: The computer screen would freeze whenever too many tabs were open.
meanings.sent2: The gears of the old clock would freeze up if not oiled regularly.
meanings.sent3: His brain seemed to freeze during the exam, and he couldn't remember the answers.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to freeze as they shared a perfect moment together.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure can freeze someone's ability to take risks.

meanings.definition: (noun) the act of freezing or the state of being frozen
meanings.sent1: The freeze of the lake meant no more ice skating for the season.
meanings.sent2: The freeze in the air signaled the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent3: The sudden freeze caught everyone off guard, and they had to bundle up quickly.
meanings.sent4: The freeze of the computer screen made it impossible to continue working.
meanings.sent5: The freeze of fear in her eyes was evident as she faced the unknown.
